# Arpeggio: Minor 6th in B (Shape: A)

## Overview
This arpeggio is a Minor 6th in the key of B and is played using the A shape on the guitar. It can provide a melancholic and emotive sound to your playing. mastering this arpeggio will add depth and variety to your musical compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- D (Minor 3rd)
- F# (5th)
- G# (6th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio is commonly used in genres such as Jazz, Blues, and Pop music. It adds a soulful and expressive quality to the music, giving it a touch of sophistication and emotion.

## Songs
1. **"Autumn Leaves" by Joseph Kosma** - This jazz standard prominently features minor 6th arpeggios in various sections of the song, adding a smooth and mellow vibe to the composition.
   
2. **"No Good" by Kaleo** - The song incorporates minor 6th arpeggios in its guitar passages, creating a haunting and moody atmosphere that enhances the overall intensity of the track.

3. **"Ordinary People" by John Legend** - This R&B ballad uses minor 6th arpeggios to evoke a sense of vulnerability and raw emotion, contributing to the heartfelt delivery of the lyrics.
